Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the playing board in the game in the form of an array of BoardLocations. It is used to hold all the location information in the form of BoardLocation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(java.io.File file)
      This is the constructor for the game Board, which loads and parses a CSV data file for dynamic configuration that enables rapid game modification.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getInfo(int position)
      This method calls getInformation() from respective BoardLocation and is used to get the information of a specific location.
      java.util.ArrayList<BoardLocation> getLocationsOwnedByPlayer(Player player)
      This method returns all the properties owned by the specified player.
      int getNumberOfHotelsDevelopedByPlayer(Player player)
      This method returns the number of hotels the specified player currently has on the board.
      int getNumberOfHousesDevelopedByPlayer(Player player)
      This method returns the total number of houses the specified player currently has on the board.
      int getNumberOfLocationsOwnedByPlayerUsingColour(Player player, java.lang.String colourCheck)
      The number of properties a player owns of the given colour.
      void populateBoard(java.io.File file)
      This method populated the board given the csv file of location details.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(java.io.File file)
        This is the constructor for the game Board, which loads and parses a CSV data file for dynamic configuration that enables rapid game modification.
        Parameters:
        file - A csv file containing the information to create every location on the board. [Board.csv]

    • Method Detail

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo(int position)
        This method calls getInformation() from respective BoardLocation and is used to get the information of a specific location.
        Parameters:
        position - int value refering to location at index of board.
        Returns:
        String A string containing all the information of the specific location.

      • getLocationsOwnedByPlayer

        public java.util.ArrayList<BoardLocation> getLocationsOwnedByPlayer(Player player)
        This method returns all the properties owned by the specified player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whos properties you want in the ArrayList.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of all properties of the specified player.

      • getNumberOfHousesDevelopedByPlayer

        public int getNumberOfHousesDevelopedByPlayer(Player player)
        This method returns the total number of houses the specified player currently has on the board.
        Parameters:
        player - The player of which you want to find out how many houses they own.
        Returns:
        The number of houses the specified player owns.

      • getNumberOfHotelsDevelopedByPlayer

        public int getNumberOfHotelsDevelopedByPlayer(Player player)
        This method returns the number of hotels the specified player currently has on the board.
        Parameters:
        player - The player of which you want to find out how many hotels they own.
        Returns:
        The number of hotels the specified player owns.

      • getNumberOfLocationsOwnedByPlayerUsingColour

        public int getNumberOfLocationsOwnedByPlayerUsingColour(Player player,
                                                        java.lang.String colourCheck)
        The number of properties a player owns of the given colour.
        Parameters:
        player - The player of which you want to find out how many properties of a given colour you want to find.
        colourCheck - The colour of the property you want to know how many the player owns of.
        Returns:
        int The number of properties of colourCheck owned by the player

      • populateBoard

        public void populateBoard(java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method populated the board given the csv file of location details. If the file is not found or not as expected, a FileNotFoundException or IOException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        file - The csv file containing the location details.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - File not found
